intro: Cyclopogon hirtzii, commonly known as the hairy cyclopogon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to southern Mexico and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
